## Quarto

Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see <https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/>.

## Important

::: {.callout-caution collapse="false"}
## How to clone a Github repo

1.  Make sure you have a GitHub account!

2.  Navigate to <https://github.com/phenrickson/getting-started>

3.  Click on the green "Code" button and copy the url under the HTTPS tab <https://github.com/phenrickson/getting-started>

4.  In RStudio, use File \> New Project \> Version Control \> From Git \> and then paste the URL into the source repo box and then click enter!

:::

## Bullets

When you click the **Render** button a document will be generated that includes:

-   Content authored with markdown
-   Output from executable code
-   oooh

## Code

When you click the **Render** button a presentation will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

```{r}
1 + 1
```

```{r}
#| output-location: column
#| label: fig-airquality
#| fig-cap: Temperature and ozone level.
#| warning: false
#| message: false

library(ggplot2)

ggplot(airquality, aes(Temp, Ozone)) + 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "loess"
)
```
. . .

Showing data

```{r}
#| message: false
#| warning: false
#| echo: fenced

mtcars |>
  dplyr::filter(mpg > 20)

```

## Mermaid

```{mermaid}
graph TD;

    A[Main Branch] --> B1[Jim's Feature Branch]
    A --> B2[Phil's Feature Branch]
    B1 --> C1{Work on Feature}
    B2 --> C2{Work on Feature}
    C1 --> D1[Commit Changes]
    C2 --> D2[Commit Changes]
    D1 --> E1[Push Changes to Jim's Feature Branch]
    D2 --> E2[Push Changes to Phil's Feature Branch]
    E1 --> F1[Create Pull Request]
    E2 --> F2[Create Pull Request]
    F1 --> G1[Review Code]
    F2 --> G2[Review Code]
    G1 --> H1[Approve Changes]
    G2 --> H2[Approve Changes]
    H1 --> I1[Merge Pull Request]
    H2 --> I2[Merge Pull Request]
    I1 --> J1[Delete Jim's Feature Branch]
    I2 --> J2[Delete Phil's Feature Branch]

```
